snippet: The Eagles sold the narrative of a young black player’s suspected gang affiliation to rationalize parting ways with their best receiver.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column defends NFL star receiver DeSean Jackson, who was released by Philadelphia Eagles after six seasons because of alleged character issues; agrees that Jackson is rambunctious and has occasionally exhibited poor judgement, but argues that the Eagles knew this before giving him a five-year contract extension in 2012; says this was a disgraceful way for a franchise to try to cover its back while releasing its best player.
lead_paragraph: The Eagles sold the narrative of a young black player’s suspected gang affiliation to rationalize parting ways with their best receiver.

headline.main: Parting With DeSean Jackson, the Eagles Added a Kick
headline.print_headline: Parting With a Star, and Adding a Kick
